org.matrix.olm

Class OlmAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matrix.olm.CommonSerializeUtils
      • org.matrix.olm.OlmAccount
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class OlmAccount
extends CommonSerializeUtils
implements java.io.Serializable
    Account class used to create Olm sessions in conjunction with OlmSession class.
    OlmAccount provides APIs to retrieve the Olm keys.

    Detailed implementation guide is available at Implementing End-to-End Encryption in Matrix clients.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String JSON_KEY_FINGER_PRINT_KEY
      Ed25519 finger print is a public-key cryptographic system for signing messages.
      In Matrix, each device has an Ed25519 key pair which serves to identify that device.
      static java.lang.String JSON_KEY_IDENTITY_KEY
      Curve25519 identity key is a public-key cryptographic system which can be used to establish a shared secret.
      In Matrix, each device has a long-lived Curve25519 identity key which is used to establish Olm sessions with that device.
      static java.lang.String JSON_KEY_ONE_TIME_KEY
      As well as the identity key, each device creates a number of Curve25519 key pairs which are also used to establish Olm sessions, but can only be used once.
      private static java.lang.String LOG_TAG 
      private long mNativeId
      Account Id returned by JNI.
      private static long serialVersionUID

      Ex: { "curve25519": { "AAAABQ":"qefVZd8qvjOpsFzoKSAdfUnJVkIreyxWFlipCHjSQQg", "AAAABA":"/X8szMU+p+lsTnr56wKjaLgjTMQQkCk8EIWEAilZtQ8", "AAAAAw":"qxNxxFHzevFntaaPdT0fhhO7tc7pco4+xB/5VRG81hA", } }
      Public API for oneTimeKeysJni().
      Note: these keys are to be published on the server.
      private byte[] oneTimeKeysJni()
      Get the public parts of the unpublished "one time keys" for the account.
      The returned data is a JSON-formatted object with the single property curve25519, which is itself an object mapping key id to base64-encoded Curve25519 key.

      • serialVersionUID

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_TAG

        private static final java.lang.String LOG_TAG
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JSON_KEY_ONE_TIME_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String JSON_KEY_ONE_TIME_KEY
        As well as the identity key, each device creates a number of Curve25519 key pairs which are also used to establish Olm sessions, but can only be used once. Once again, the private part remains on the device. but the public part is published to the Matrix network
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JSON_KEY_IDENTITY_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String JSON_KEY_IDENTITY_KEY
        Curve25519 identity key is a public-key cryptographic system which can be used to establish a shared secret.
        In Matrix, each device has a long-lived Curve25519 identity key which is used to establish Olm sessions with that device. The private key should never leave the device, but the public part is signed with the Ed25519 fingerprint key (JSON_KEY_FINGER_PRINT_KEY) and published to the network.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JSON_KEY_FINGER_PRINT_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String JSON_KEY_FINGER_PRINT_KEY
        Ed25519 finger print is a public-key cryptographic system for signing messages.
        In Matrix, each device has an Ed25519 key pair which serves to identify that device. The private the key should never leave the device, but the public part is published to the Matrix network.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • mNativeId

        private transient long mNativeId
        Account Id returned by JNI. This value identifies uniquely the native account instance.

        public OlmAccount()
           throws OlmException
        Throws:

    • Method Detail

      • createNewAccountJni

        private long createNewAccountJni()
        Create a new account and return it to JAVA side.
        Since a C prt is returned as a jlong, special care will be taken to make the cast (OlmAccount* to jlong) platform independent.
        Returns:
        the initialized OlmAccount* instance or throw an exception if fails

      • getOlmAccountId

        long getOlmAccountId()
        Getter on the account ID.
        Returns:
        native account ID

      • releaseAccount

        public void releaseAccount()
        Release native account and invalid its JAVA reference counter part.
        Public API for releaseAccountJni().

      • releaseAccountJni

        private void releaseAccountJni()
        Destroy the corresponding OLM account native object.
        This method must ALWAYS be called when this JAVA instance is destroyed (ie. garbage collected) to prevent memory leak in native side. See createNewAccountJni().

      • isReleased

        public boolean isReleased()
        Return true the object resources have been released.
        Returns:
        true the object resources have been released

      • identityKeys

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> identityKeys()
                                                              throws OlmException
        Return the identity keys (identity and fingerprint keys) in a dictionary.
        Public API for identityKeysJni().
        Ex: { "curve25519":"Vam++zZPMqDQM6ANKpO/uAl5ViJSHxV9hd+b0/fwRAg", "ed25519":"+v8SOlOASFTMrX3MCKBM4iVnYoZ+JIjpNt1fi8Z9O2I" }
        Returns:
        identity keys dictionary if operation succeeds, null otherwise
        Throws:
        OlmException - the failure reason

      • identityKeysJni

        private byte[] identityKeysJni()
        Get the public identity keys (Ed25519 fingerprint key and Curve25519 identity key).
        Keys are Base64 encoded. These keys must be published on the server.
        Returns:
        the identity keys or throw an exception if it fails

      • maxOneTimeKeys

        public long maxOneTimeKeys()
        Return the largest number of "one time keys" this account can store.
        Returns:
        the max number of "one time keys", -1 otherwise

      • maxOneTimeKeysJni

        private long maxOneTimeKeysJni()
        Return the largest number of "one time keys" this account can store.
        Returns:
        the max number of "one time keys", -1 otherwise

      • generateOneTimeKeys

        public void generateOneTimeKeys(int aNumberOfKeys)
                         throws OlmException
        Generate a number of new one time keys.
        If total number of keys stored by this account exceeds maxOneTimeKeys(), the old keys are discarded.
        The corresponding keys are retrieved by oneTimeKeys().
        Parameters:
        aNumberOfKeys - number of keys to generate
        Throws:
        OlmException - the failure reason

      • generateOneTimeKeysJni

        private void generateOneTimeKeysJni(int aNumberOfKeys)
        Generate a number of new one time keys.
        If total number of keys stored by this account exceeds maxOneTimeKeys(), the old keys are discarded. An exception is thrown if the operation fails.
        Parameters:
        aNumberOfKeys - number of keys to generate

      • oneTimeKeys

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> oneTimeKeys()
                                                                                             throws OlmException
        Return the "one time keys" in a dictionary.
        The number of "one time keys", is specified by generateOneTimeKeys(int)
        Ex: { "curve25519": { "AAAABQ":"qefVZd8qvjOpsFzoKSAdfUnJVkIreyxWFlipCHjSQQg", "AAAABA":"/X8szMU+p+lsTnr56wKjaLgjTMQQkCk8EIWEAilZtQ8", "AAAAAw":"qxNxxFHzevFntaaPdT0fhhO7tc7pco4+xB/5VRG81hA", } }
        Public API for oneTimeKeysJni().
        Note: these keys are to be published on the server.
        Returns:
        one time keys in string dictionary.
        Throws:
        OlmException - the failure reason

      • oneTimeKeysJni

        private byte[] oneTimeKeysJni()
        Get the public parts of the unpublished "one time keys" for the account.
        The returned data is a JSON-formatted object with the single property curve25519, which is itself an object mapping key id to base64-encoded Curve25519 key.
        Returns:
        byte array containing the one time keys or throw an exception if it fails

      • removeOneTimeKeys

        public void removeOneTimeKeys(OlmSession aSession)
                       throws OlmException
        Remove the "one time keys" that the session used from the account.
        Parameters:
        aSession - session instance
        Throws:
        OlmException - the failure reason

      • removeOneTimeKeysJni

        private void removeOneTimeKeysJni(long aNativeOlmSessionId)
        Remove the "one time keys" that the session used from the account. An exception is thrown if the operation fails.
        Parameters:
        aNativeOlmSessionId - native session instance identifier

        Throws:
        OlmException - the failure reason

      • markOneTimeKeysAsPublishedJni

        private void markOneTimeKeysAsPublishedJni()
        Marks the current set of "one time keys" as being published. An exception is thrown if the operation fails.

      • serialize

        protected byte[] serialize(byte[] aKey,
                           java.lang.StringBuffer aErrorMsg)
        Return an account as a bytes buffer.
        The account is serialized and encrypted with aKey. In case of failure, an error human readable description is provide in aErrorMsg.
        Specified by:
        serialize in class CommonSerializeUtils
        Parameters:
        aKey - encryption key
        aErrorMsg - error message description
        Returns:
        the account as bytes buffer

      • serializeJni

        private byte[] serializeJni(byte[] aKeyBuffer)
        Serialize and encrypt account instance.
        Parameters:
        aKeyBuffer - key used to encrypt the serialized account data
        Returns:
        the serialised account as bytes buffer.
